alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Knott; Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Knott, northwestern Floyd, east central Breathitt and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Evanston, or 14 miles south of Salyersville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Evanston and Duco around 705 PM EDT. Waldo and Vail around 710 PM EDT. Orchard, Gunlock, Ordway, Fredville, Gapville and Handshoe around 715 PM EDT. Pyramid, Hippo, Mid and Brainard around 720 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hueysville, Blue River, Eastern, Bosco, Dotson, Garret, Porter Junction, Martin, Alphoretta, Langley, Dock, Printer, Hunter, Cliff, Drift and Minnie. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 13. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 19 and 20. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 14 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
